newsitem.title: UK: INTERVIEW-Harvey Nichols upbeat on growth.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW-Harvey Nichols upbeat on growth.

text.p: Harvey Nichols Group Plc, the high fashion department store, said on Monday it was looking for growth from outside London, but had no news yet on plans for new stores in Glasgow, Edinburgh or Manchester.

The company, whose flagship store is in London's exclusive Knightsbridge, said it was fairly advanced in terms of negotiations for new stores, but was not in a position to give Finance director Clive Morton told Reuters in a telephone interview the group believed there was scope for four Harvey Nichols shops in Britain.
He said the new store in Leeds, which opened last year, was still trading well after a spectacular first few weeks. still trading well after a spectacular first few weeks.
The retailer, which floated on the London Stock Exchange in April last year, reported a 30 percent increase in annual profits to 12.1 million stg.

Morton said a three percent increase in like-for-like sales in the first ten weeks of the current year was slightly disappointing. He said sales were up against very tough comparisons for the same period last year, when the store achieved a 20 percent increase.
Morton blamed worries about the upcoming budget on July 2 as well as the strong pound for the slower sales pace. "People are being fairly wary of the new Labour government," he said.

He expected the group would be able to announce plans for another stand alone restaurant in London the next 12 to 18 months. The existing Oxo Tower restaurant on the south bank of the Thames exceeded the company's own forecasts in terms of sales and profit. sales and contributions to profit.
Harvey Nichols shares were down five pence at 297.5 pence by 1115 GMT. -- Jane Merriman, London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
